thread.title: High school roundup: Mayfield girls' volleyball sweeps Fort Plain
thread.title_full: High school roundup: Mayfield girls' volleyball sweeps Fort Plain - Times Union

author: Staff reports
title: High school roundup: Mayfield girls' volleyball sweeps Fort Plain
text:
The Mayfield girls' volleyball team kept its unbeaten record intact with a 3-0 victory over Western Athletic Conference rival Fort Plain on Wednesday afternoon.
Kaylee Bumpus had 11 kills, two blocks, eight points, 14 digs and one assist and Ashley Madeiros added 11 points, one kill, nine digs and 18 assists for Mayfield, which improved to 12-0 overall and 8-0 in league play.
The Panthers won by scores of 25-13, 25-19 and 25-19.
Emily Potter had three kills, seven points and 11 digs and Cheyann Walters chipped in with 12 points and four aces for Fort Plain, which dipped to 8-3 overall and 7-3 in the WAC.
Boys' soccer: Stillwater edged Hoosick Falls, 3-2, in a Wasaren League contest. The Warriors built a commanding 3-0 lead and held off a late Panthers' rally. Brody Cepiel and Justin Flanagan scored first-half goals for Stillwater before Cepiel added another goal to put the Warriors ahead 3-0 late in the second half. In the game's final five minutes, Tyler Gaines put away a penalty shot to make it 3-1 and Riley Bacon scored with 1:30 remaining to put Hoosick Falls down by just one, but the Panthers ran out of time before they could get the equalizer. ... Fonda squeaked past Cohoes, 2-1, in overtime. Stiven Florez scored the game-winning goal on a penalty kick in extra time for the Braves . Florez also assisted on Fonda's first goal by Zach Guffree. Peter Frament scored the lone goal for Cohoes. ... Anthony Clementis , Adam Urbeatis, Marcus Tobin and Colby DeMarco netted goals to lead Mechanicville over Granville, 4-0. C.J. Tironi made four saves to earn the shutout. The Red Raiders held a 12-3 edge in corners.
Girls' soccer: Jewel Pietrzak and Rachel Cahill scored goals to help Berlin top Loudonville Christian, 2-0, in a Central Hudson Valley League contest at Berlin. Jordan Cahill had seven saves to pick up the win in goal for the Mountaineers. Annisa Szesnat made 18 saves for Loudonville Christian. ... Emma Willard coasted to a 7-0 victory over New Lebanon in another CHVL game. Cara Lacosz and Bella Rody-Wright each had two goals to lead the Jaspers .
Boys' volleyball: Cody Pearce had 15 assists, six kills and two blocks and Brad Albright added 11 kills and two blocks as Burnt Hills topped Guilderland, 25-14, 25-14, 25-9. Ben Keppler and J.J. Zwickbauer each had six kills for the Spartans (12-4, 10-2).
Field hockey: Kayleigh Papa scored the game's only goal in the second overtime to give Shaker a 1-0 win over Niskayuna in a Suburban Council clash. Lauren Brock and Kat Stasior assisted Papa on the game winner and keeper Emily Polsinello stopped 10 shots to earn the shutout for the Blue Bison. Emma Skumurski made eight saves for Niskayuna.
